definitions: a person or thing that traces something or by which something may be traced.
shortDefinitions: person or thing that traces something or by which something may be traced

definitions: a bullet or shell whose course is made visible in flight by a trail of flames or smoke, used to assist in aiming

examples.text: the night sky turned into a light show of artillery, flares, and tracers
the night was lit up by tracer

shortDefinitions: bullet or shell whose course is made visible in flight by trail of flames

definitions: a substance introduced into a biological organism or other system so that its subsequent distribution can be readily followed from its color, fluorescence, radioactivity, or other distinctive property

examples.text: they used radioactive carbon as a tracer
transfer of tracer from spinal fluid to blood

shortDefinitions: substance introduced into biological organism or other system so that its subsequent distribution may be readily followed from its colour

definitions: a device which transmits a signal and so can be located when attached to a moving vehicle or other object.
shortDefinitions: device which transmits signal and so can be located when attached to moving vehicle or other object
